intro: Leplaea mayombensis var. coalescens, commonly known as the Mayombé lily, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and has strap-like, dark green leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer and are notable for their fragrance and intricate petal structure. Due to habitat loss, it is considered critically endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
